#include <openssl/aes.h>
#include "aes_locl.h"
#include <string.h>

 RFC3686 implementation.

 RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion.

 RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion.

int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_final (AES_KEY *key, uint8_t *data, uint32_t dlen, uint8_t *res, void *state)
 RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion After this call no update/final should be called.

void AES_ctr128_encrypt (  const unsigned char *    in,
unsigned char *    out,
const unsigned long    length,
const AES_KEY *    key,
unsigned char    ivec[AES_BLOCK_SIZE],
unsigned char    ecount_buf[AES_BLOCK_SIZE],
unsigned int *    num
) 
 

void AES_ctr128_inc (  unsigned char *    counter )  [static]
 

int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt (  uint64_t *    key,
uint32_t    bits,
uint64_t    orgiv,
uint32_t    nonce,
uint64_t *    data,
uint32_t    dlen,
uint64_t *    res
) 
 

RFC3686 implementation.

Parameters:
key  pointer to key
bits  length of key in bits (should be 16*8 or 24*8 or 32*8)
orgiv  eight byte initial vector
nonce  initial nonce(refer RFC 3686)
data  data pointer
dlen  length of data in bytes
res  pointer to byte array where result of encryption should be written
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure

int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_final (  AES_KEY *    key,
uint8_t *    data,
uint32_t    dlen,
uint8_t *    res,
void *    state
) 
 

RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion After this call no update/final should be called.

Parameters:
key  pointer to AES_KEY structure passed to cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_init function
data  pointer to plain text to be encrypted
dlen  length of data pointed to by data(should be non-zero).
dlen  Note that if total dlen is a multiple of 16, atleast one final call is mandatory
res  pointer to location where encrypted text should be written
state  Pre-Allocated AES_CTR_CTX pointer that was passed to init function
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure

int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_init (  uint8_t *    orgkey,
uint32_t    bits,
AES_KEY *    key,
uint64_t    iv,
uint32_t    nonce,
void *    state
) 
 

RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion.

Parameters:
orgkey  pointer to key
bits  length of key in bits (128,192,256 are only allowed values)
key  pointer to AES_KEY structure to be initialized
iv  8 byte initialization vector
nonce  initial nonce(refer RFC 3686)
state  pointer to Pre-Allocated AES_CTR_CTX structure, opaque quantity to user
Returns:
0 on success,-1 on failure.

int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_update (  AES_KEY *    key,
uint8_t *    data,
uint32_t    dlen,
uint8_t *    res,
void *    state
) 
 

RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion.

Parameters:
key  pointer to AES_KEY structure passed to cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_init function
data  pointer to plain text to be encrypted
dlen  length of data pointed to by data. If dlen is not a multiple of 16 this is considered as the final call,no further update/final functions should be called
dlen  Note that if total dlen is a multiple of 16, atleast one final call is mandatory
res  pointer to location where encrypted text should be written
state  Pre-Allocated AES_CTR_CTX pointer that was passed to init function
Returns:
0 on success,-1 on failure
